It is certainly true that the artists and intellectuals of the Renaissance were responsible for the great works of art and other intellectual achievements of the time. However, the Medici family played an important role in providing the necessary resources, support, and patronage that allowed these artists and intellectuals to create their masterpieces. 

At the time, it was difficult for artists and intellectuals to fund their own work. Patronage was a common way of supporting artists and thinkers, and the Medici family were among the most influential patrons of their time. Their support and patronage helped to create a cultural environment that had a profound impact on the development of art and intellectuality in Italy.

Furthermore, the wealth and power of the Medici family allowed them to make significant contributions to the flourishing of the arts and sciences. Their patronage was not purely a matter of self-promotion or vanity; they truly embraced humanistic values and the promotion of culture. 

Therefore, while the artists and intellectuals of the Renaissance deserve all the credit for their creative achievements, it is important to recognize the significant role played by the Medici family in providing the resources and support that allowed these achievements to happen. The Medici family's patronage was a vital factor in the intellectual and cultural development of Italy during the Renaissance, and their impact has been recognized and celebrated for many centuries.
